Underground Valley
  The light at the end of the tunnel!!  You feel so relieved after being
cramped up in the caverns.  You must be getting closer to the Citadel.  From
a distance, you can hear the warcries and clashing of swords..  Turning your
head towards the sounds, you come upon a small valley that has been burned
down by fighting.  You step closer to the burning bushes and trees and
hear the sounds grow stronger.  You must be close to the battlefield!

At the Mouth of a Cave (G)
  The path that you followed has led you to an uninviting cave.  It is dark
and eerie, your judgement tells you that it is not wise to proceed further. 
In the distance you hear the faint sounds of screams and swords slashing. 
Wondering what could be happening ahead you decide to continue into the cave
and explore.

At the Mouth of a Cave (G)
  The path that you followed has led you to an uninviting cave.  It is dark
and eerie, your judgement tells you that it is not wise to proceed further. 
In the distance you hear the faint sounds of screams and swords slashing. 
Wondering what could be happening ahead you decide to continue into the cave
and explore.

d
The Nyx's Room
  The stench of mold surrounds you in the dark cave.  It is quiet, the only
sounds to be heard are the dripping of water from the ceiling, and a faint
scuffling sound.  Wondering what the sound is you explore the cave further. 
The walls are smooth and slimy, your feet squelch with every step you take. 
Looking down you notice the floor is covered with worms and beetles..  Yuck!
Your disgust is overshadowed by fear when you notice a hunched over figure
in the corner of the room.  

[ Exits: up ]
( 2) A dark pair of sleeves, woven from a spider's web.
(Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (Angry) A dark creature hides in the shadows here, protected
from the light.
The Cave Nyx exclaims 'Why do you disturb me? Leave me in peace!'
The Cave Nyx screams at you!  That's not nice!  *sniff*

The Nyx's Room
  The stench of mold surrounds you in the dark cave.  It is quiet, the only
sounds to be heard are the dripping of water from the ceiling, and a faint
scuffling sound.  Wondering what the sound is you explore the cave further. 
The walls are smooth and slimy, your feet squelch with every step you take. 
Looking down you notice the floor is covered with worms and beetles..  Yuck!
Your disgust is overshadowed by fear when you notice a hunched over figure
in the corner of the room.  

[ Exits: up ]
( 2) A dark pair of sleeves, woven from a spider's web.

Deeper Within the Cavern

your eyes adjust to the darkness.  The darkness is getting to you and you
start to panic!!  While frantically looking for a way out, you feel the
breeze brush your cheek.  There must be an exit nearby.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
(Player) Ruo the Elementalist.
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Pathway to Snuckles Forest
  This forest holds magic that is stronger than any other in the land.  The
faeries have spent centuries in this forest, instilling it with magical
powers to protect them from harm.  The trees are like none around.  Each
tree has leaves a different color from the next.  The wind rustles the
leaves and the smell of rain is in the air.

Southern Edge Of The Pond
  The edge of the pond makes a semi circle here, creating plenty of space
to reach the water.  The pond continues to the north.  The east side of the
semi circle is very soggy and swamp-like, yet the west side slowly slopes
down to the water.  A couple of animals are peacefully drinking water from
the pond.  The path leads from the edge of the pond to the far west.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
The Picturesque Pond
  Cat-tails, lily pads with various colored water lilies, and spatterdock
decorate the surface of the pond.  Ducks dive under the water in search of
food.  Going a bit into the water brings forth more marine life and
different kinds of plants.  Where the sun can still reach the bottom of the
pond, wigeon grass, milfoil, and coontail grow heartily.  The pond is very
deep in the middle, and to get across one must be able to swim very well, or
own a boat.  

[ Exits: south west ]
(Golden Aura) The tadpole feasts on its meal in the shallow part of the pond.
(Red Aura) The fish swims briefly to the surface, then heads back to deeper water.
(Red Aura) The fish swims briefly to the surface, then heads back to deeper water.
(Golden Aura) The tadpole feasts on its meal in the shallow part of the pond.
(Red Aura) The fish swims briefly to the surface, then heads back to deeper water.

Edge Of The Pond
  Green fern is growing along the shore of the pond.  A small trail leads
from the pond to the north.  An old tree stands crooked and its blue leaves
touch the surface of the water.  It almost appears as if the water colored
the leaves.  The trees are spaciously positioned around the path, yet their
branches and leaves touch, forming a closed off roof.  The occasional
sunbeam manages the get through the lush trees.

n
Snuckle Forest
  The trees in this part of the forest are not so high, but there are
numerous trees.  Each tree has a different color, although sometimes just
the shade is different.  The faeries must have been very busy in this part
of the forest.  Maybe they were trying to create some kind of wall, a wall
made out of leaves with an abundance in color.  A field of flowers lies
between the trees, providing a very nice scent that dwindles in the air.

     The snuckleberry bushes are full of ripe red and blue snuckleberries.

Thinning Trees
  The trees are smaller here, spreading out more.  Thick bushes cover the
ground between the trees to the east and their vines are tangled together.

the distance a glimpse of a dark tower can be seen.  Jagged rocks line its
base.

Before The Wolves' Den (1737)

Overlooking The Refuge (1732)

The brown thrasher lands near the snuckleberry bush.

The brown thrasher takes flight and begins singing again.
Mushroom Patch
  The path narrows here, giving way to the thousands of mushrooms that grow
on the sides of the path.  The mushrooms are harvested for eating, and grow
back almost overnight.  The snuckles use the mushrooms for a major part of
their diet, although they eat other things as well.  Birds are sitting in
the trees singing a lovely song to entertain those who are picking
mushrooms.  

[ Exits: east west ]

A Begadela
  This house has just recently been sold to a new owner.  There are boxes

northern walls.  A few pictures hang on the walls, but most are still packed

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Between the clouds
  You are flying between the clouds. The air currents here allow you to easily 
float in the air. However they still restrict your movement in any direction 
other than up and down. The clouds block out the sun, but some light still 
filters through them. The air smells of ozone and the hint of electricity 
fills the air.

An aerial street
  This aerial pathway continues to the north and south. Hawklords climb onto 
air currents and fly down the street, zipping by you. Bird cries echo in your
ears, as birds of prey swoop from the sky towards the earth. Children float 
on the air and play games. Several attack each other with swords, while 
others defend themselves with tridents. A small building floats below you, 
and there are large buildings to the east and west.

The eastern housing unit
  You are standing in the eastern housing unit. This unit houses a large 
number of the hawklords. Bunk beds line the walls. Each has a locker and 
trunk nearby for storage of personal items. Curtains are pulled around some 
of the beds, perhaps to give a sense of privacy. Some of the beds contain 
sleeping hawklords. They appear to be attired in their full armor, ready to 
wake for battle. A mother chases her flying son around the room, while the 
child keeps just out of reach.

u
The Floating Temple
  This is the Floating Temple of Jupiter, the god of sky and thunder. The 
clouds float overhead as the temple is open to the sky. This represents the 
dedication to their god. The clouds seem to take the shape of a hunt rushing 
across the sky. The wall appears to depict a story of Jupiter.

The Floating Temple
  This is the Floating Temple of Jupiter, the god of sky and thunder. The 
temple is open to the sky. The floor is a solid mat so that believers can 
kneel when they pray. The walls are decorated with the stories of Jupiter.
Several worshippers kneel here with their foreheads pressed against the floor
in prayer. The sun seems to blaze with greater intensity here, as though it 
is drawing power from the prayers.

[ Exits: north east ]

The Floating Temple
  You are standing in the center of the temple. A huge statue of Jupiter stands
in the middle of the room, overlooking his subjects. His hands are stretched 
out as if he is ready to take flight. A large gathering of hawklords have 
gathering in front of the statue as they attempt touch the statue. According 
to the legends, the statue has the power to heal the sick and make the old 
young again. Other legends state that by touching the statue, that Jupiter 
will personally collect your soul you when you die.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

The Floating Temple

temple is open to the sky so that supplicants can kneel and pray without 
anything blocking their access to the sky god. Mats are placed around the

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1734)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Grand Entrance to the Fair
  You stand before the gates of a large fair.  A nearby sign proclaims this
to be the Great Tournament of Illoria.  Nearby, you hear melodic tunes
playing, and the mixed aromas of cooked meat and fresh pies fill the air. 
You are glad you came on the day you did - it seems this fair is not to be
missed!

The Grand Square
  You're standing in the middle of the fair.  A huge maypole is here, with
ribbons and flowers strung to it.  You see more people laughing, talking,
eating, and drinking.  You smile at what you see.  There are more fair
grounds to the south, and a less crowded path leads off to the west.  To the
east you see a tent that is slightly larger than the others.

Amongst the slag
  You make your way carefully over the piles of loose slag and rock.  Small
pools of scummy water and the odd weed are the only other things that you
can see for several hundred meters in any direction.

[ Exits: east south west ]

s
Path between the mud-pools
  You make your way carefully along the narrow trail between bubbling pools
of stinking mud.  Large piles of slag rise up on all sides, and small
lizards slither out of your way and into dark holes.  You hope there is no
big lizard lurking somewhere nearby!  

[ Exits: north east south ]
     (Magic) A family of dust mites runs about beneath your feet here.
     (Invis) (Glow) (Polished) A Bahamut's Fang lies here.

Entrance to a hole
  You have arrived at the entrance to a large hole that plunges deep into
the side of a slag-pile.  Strange shuffling noises can be heard coming from
deep inside, and the smell reminds you of rotting garbage.  You can take the
trail west between the mud-pools, or go down into the dark hole.

Climbing the cliff
  Rough winds buffet you as you cling to the rockface. Looking down you see a 
hellish landscape of bubbling mud-pools, lakes of fire, and clouds of mist 
and gaseous vapours. Off in the distance you see many bat-like creatures 
flying around. Some seem to be circling in one place, and you shudder to 
think why.

[ Exits: up down ]

Entrance to a hole

Inside the hole
  You creep slowly along, trying to keep your footing on the loose slag. 
Your light casts flickering shadows on the walls.  The sound of shuffling
grows louder to the east, and you hear a faint slurping sound.  The smell is
also quite strong here and you try to breathe lightly.  

[ Exits: east up ]
(Red Aura) A huge red-scaled mound shambles about the cave.

T-intersection
  You stand at a T-intersection in the dark tunnel under the slag-pile. 
Exits are to the west, north and south.  Sounds of slurping and shuffling
come from the north and south.  The smell of rotting meat fills the air,
making you gag.

e
Entrance to the fire-swamp
  You stand at the northern edge of a large lake of burning oil and mud. Small 
asbestos covered plants eke out a living here. To the north is a large stand 
of tall fireweed and snapdragons. The air is filled with smoke and the ever 
present stench of sulphur.

[ Exits: north east south ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 1742/1763 HP  1397/2233 MP  1722/1738 mv  933tnl  
Lv 83  G 382164 | Entrance to the fire-swamp (NES)
s
>>    *[NOEXP]* Deep in the Fire Swamp
  You stand on a large chunk of basalt rising up from the burning gases of
the swamp.  All around you see the charred remains of creatures unfortunate
enough to fall into the inferno.  To the south and west you see other lumps
of dark rock, perhaps you could jump to one of them?  

[ Exits: east south west ]

(Red Aura) A harbinger of evil flaps through the air.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1742/1763 HP  1397/2233 MP  1721/1738 mv  933tnl  
Lv 83  G 382164 | Deep in the Fire Swamp (ESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* In the fire-swamp
  You stand precariously balanced on a large chunk of basalt. Burning oil laps 
at your boots, and you decide not to stay here to long. Clouds of black smoke
hang in the air making it hard to breathe. Small bat-like creatures flit 
about and long fire-snakes slither into the mud. You see other stepping 
stones to the north and west. To the east and south are huge pools of burning
oil.

[ Exits: north west ]
(Red Aura) A harbinger of evil flaps through the air.

w
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Deep in the fire-swamp
  You carefully make your way through the fire-swamp by jumping from one
lump of black basalt to the next.  Luckily, enough of these large stepping
stones are present for you to avoid the pools of burning oil.  Through the
thick smoke you see more stones to the east, west and south.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Red Aura) A burning, demon-like figure is here.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1742/1763 HP  1397/2233 MP  1719/1738 mv  933tnl

>>    *[NOEXP]* Deep in the fire-swamp
  You stand in a small clump of asbestos weeds in a quiet part of the swamp.
Small lumps of basalt emerge from the pools of burning marsh to the south and
west, and a small hillock rises out of the swamp to the south-east. The air 
is full of ash and smoke, and large creatures move about in the haze.

[ Exits: east south west ]

fire-swamp. The high rock wall blocks your way to the west, and sections of

Lv 83  G 382164 | Deep in the fire-swamp (ESW)
s
>>    *[NOEXP]* Southern edge of the fire-swamp
  You stand at the southern edge of a large swamp.  Underground sources of
oil and marsh-gas seep up to the water surface, where they burn constantly,
and give off clouds of black smoke.  The occasional lump of basalt bedrock
pokes up out of the marsh, allowing careful passage across in some places.  

[ Exits: north south ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 1742/1763 HP  1397/2233 MP  1712/1738 mv  933tnl  
Lv 83  G 382164 | Southern edge of the fire-swamp (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Forest path (G)
  You walk along a overgrown forest path.  To the north you see flames and
clouds of black smoke.  To the sides of the path the forest looks
impenetrable; large bushes with foot-long thorns, and vines with
ichor-coated barbs grow in thick tangles amongst the dark trees.  To the
south the path continues on.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Forest path
  You walk along an overgrown forest path.  Little light filters in through
the overhead canopy, and the air is still and damp.  Large shapes crash
through the trees, and dark eyes shine out of the darkness, then blink and
disappear.  The path continues north and south.

s
Forest path
  You make your way along the narrow forest trail. Dark forms move about in the
thick blackness of the undergrowth. The trees seem to move about in some 
unseen wind, and it almost sounds as though they are whispering to each 
other. The path leads to the north, and to the west.

Forest path
  You make your way along the narrow forest trail. Dark forms move about in the
thick blackness of the undergrowth. The trees seem to move about in some

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Path before the Gate
  You stand on a wide, well-worn path that leads away to the west and
toward a distant forest of tall blackpines.  All around you is silence.  No
birds sing, no insects chirp; even the wind is still.  Perhaps it is the
presence of the Black Tower that stands before you to the south.  A large
black gate blocks the path directly to the south, and unless you carry the
key, you can go no further in this direction.  Perhaps it is just as well;
this place looks nasty!  

[ Exits: (south) west ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Mudpits (G)

this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training

an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as

>>    *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[*Daily Blessing*] 115/1763 HP  381/2233 MP  1733/1738 mv  966tnl  
Lv 83  G 407423 | Mudpits (EWD)
w
>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

  Oh no it looks like the perils of Aardwolf have overcome you and you have 
fallen in battle. No worries though it looks like your fellow soldiers were 
able to recover your body and resurrect your spirit. It's a strange feeling 
seeing your body on the ground. IMPORTANT: Make sure you loot everything 
off your corpse and it decomposes before you leave the room! Sometimes
you might have issues seeing the invisible objects on your corpse. You can 
buy a detect invisibility potion from our shop run s3e from here and type 
list. Also don't be afraid to ask for a miracle on clantalk. If it works 
it could help restore some of your lost experience. The Medical Lounge is 
south from here in case you need a healer.

Mudpits (G) (1737)

Recreation Room (G) (1736)

Boot Clan Public Hall (G) (1735)

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1734)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

The Desolate Pridelands (1683)

Before the Wayward Alehouse
  Just off the path through the desolate pridelands of Abend, the dark 
continent, the only building within sight stands before you. The walls appear
to be constructed of a hardy wood, though they have not aged particularly 
well, and have several patches of weather-related damage throughout the 
visible section. The building is somewhat dark, though a steady hum of many 
intermixed noises can be heard through the walls. Directly in front of you is
a simple wooden door with a splintered surface and a dull grey doorknob.
Hanging above the door is a sign signifying what this building is. It's the 
Wayward Alehouse! The gravel path under you extends to the west and to the 
east.

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 1763/1763 HP  2233/2233 MP  1682/1738 mv  966tnl  
Lv 83  G 407423 | Before the Wayward Alehouse ([N]ESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
op n

You open the door.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1763/1763 HP  2233/2233 MP  1682/1738 mv  966tnl  
Lv 83  G 407423 | Before the Wayward Alehouse (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* In the threshold of the Alehouse
  You are in the threshold of the Wayward Alehouse. The scent of smoke mixed 
with alcohol hits your nose as do the sights of this establishment. The floor
beneath you is entirely made of wood with no carpeting to speak of. Boots 
make quite a distinct thud when coming into contact with the old wood that 
makes up the floor of this building. Off to the east are the coat room and a 
staircase leading to the second floor. To the north, there the Alehouse 
extends, and you can see a bar off in the distance. The noise in here is 
quite elevated. Between the buzzing of conversation, the occasional battle 
cry, and a band off in the far corner playing "music," it can be difficult to
even hear one's own thoughts. To the west, a large open space with no tables 
or chairs to speak of.  The exit is back to the south.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

This bar patron has had waaaaaaaaay too much to drink.

Second floor hallway (1738)

Second floor hallway
  You are at the western most end of the second floor hallway, leading to the 
guest rooms. To the south is room three, and to the north is room four, as 
the metal numbers hanging on the door inform you. To the west, a sign on the 
door tells you, is the rest room. This hallways is utterly barren of any 
attempts at decoration whatsoever. It seems that the owner has either 
forgotten to decorate, or simply does not care.

[ Exits: (north) east (south) (west) ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 1568/1763 HP  2046/2233 MP  1738/1738 mv  966tnl

(Curse) Poppa smacks WeaponGuy out of his boots with a sign reading "YOUR MOM !!"
Zensch (Special Ops) tells the CLAN: 'vorpal'

help vorpal
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Vorpal Flag'.
Help Category : Equipment.
Related Helps : Wflags.
Last Updated  : 2010-05-11 22:33:42.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
A vorpal weapon has a small chance of instantly decapitating an opponent
during a fight.  This is almost totally fatal; even the slightest nick of
further damage will surely kill a victim that has suffered a vorpal blow.  A
vorpalled opponent is treated as a regular kill for purposes of experience,
objects, and dying wishes, etc.

For those that hold a particular attachment to their head, there is a wish
that prevents vorpal blows from working on oneself- see 'help wishes'.

When you vorpal a target, their hit points are set to 1 and you must hit the
target again to kill it; you may (very rarely) see a miss after a vorpal
before the target dies.  The decapitation damage that appears with a vorpal
is cosmetic and does not represent regular weapon damage or the exact total
hit points remaining on the target.


"One, two! One, two! And through and through
  The vorpal blade went snicker-snack!
He left it dead, and with its head
  He went galumphing back."   -Lewis Carroll, "Jabberwocky"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 1604/1763 HP  2090/2233 MP  1738/1738 mv  966tnl

  It is quite smelly in here. The term "bathroom" is not entirely appropriate 
to describe the scene before you. It is quite literally a wooden bench with a
hole in it. This is, after all, where the patrons and guests of the Alehouse

>>    *[NOEXP]* Guest room three
  The third guest room of the Wayward Alehouse is before you. The bed in this 
room is unkempt, a pale bluish blanket half on the bed, half on the floor. A

From below, you can hear the band playing through the floor. It must be 
difficult to sleep in this place with all the noise going at all hours of the
night.

A room overlooking the horse pasture
  You stand in the so-called "premium suite" of the Wayward Alehouse. This is 
the owner's best attempt at providing a higher class room for his clients.
Really, it is the same as the other rooms, except with a view and perhaps 
cleaner sheets. There is no obvious light source aside from the windows, 
which seem to have actually been cleaned. A bed, small armoire, and wooden 
desk adorn the room making it moderately livable, if only for a day or two.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
d
Coat (Armor) Check
  This is the coat room of the Wayward Alehouse. Patrons are encouraged to 
leave their unnecessary outer garments in this room for safekeeping while 
they enjoy the festivities of the bar area. "Coat" room is not entirely 
correct, as there are not many coats here, but rather pieces of armor.
Hanging on the walls, pieces of armor range from the simplest of hide tunics 
to steel breastplates, to horned battle helmets. There is a window giving a 
rather drab view of the path around the Alehouse. There is also a weapons 
rack, though it is oddly empty. A staircase extends northward to the second 
floor, and the only other obvious exit is back to the Alehouse proper.

[ Exits: west up ]

Lv 83  G 416255 | Coat (Armor) Check (WU)
>>    
w
In the threshold of the Alehouse
  You are in the threshold of the Wayward Alehouse. The scent of smoke mixed 
with alcohol hits your nose as do the sights of this establishment. The floor
beneath you is entirely made of wood with no carpeting to speak of. Boots 
make quite a distinct thud when coming into contact with the old wood that 
makes up the floor of this building. Off to the east are the coat room and a 
staircase leading to the second floor. To the north, there the Alehouse 
extends, and you can see a bar off in the distance. The noise in here is 
quite elevated. Between the buzzing of conversation, the occasional battle 
cry, and a band off in the far corner playing "music," it can be difficult to
even hear one's own thoughts. To the west, a large open space with no tables 
or chairs to speak of.  The exit is back to the south.

[ Exits: north east (south) west ]
This guy sure knows how to dance!  Look at him get down!
An Alehouse server rushes by, nearly bumping into you as she takes a drink to a patron.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1763/1763 HP  2104/2233 MP  1738/1738 mv  966tnl  
Lv 83  G 416255 | In the threshold of the Alehouse (NE[S]W)

crc
cast 'word of recall'
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1763/1763 HP  2074/2233 MP  1737/1738 mv  966tnl  
Lv 83  G 416255 | Mudpits (EWD)
e
>>    
e
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1763/1763 HP  2074/2233 MP  1736/1738 mv  966tnl  
Lv 83  G 416255 | Recreation Room (ESW)
>>    Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Steps to Comfrey Manor
  Taking fine steps, you brush yourself past Comfrey Fountain
as you make your way up to the great steps of Lord Comfrey's
manor. The steps here are grand, with a polish that any god
or goddess would admire. Glancing at your reflection, you take
hold of the golden railing that leads up to the mahogany doors.

  This is the hallway to the guest rooms. With the wedding festivities

expensive tapestries and the floor is marble. You can see guests
rushing in and out of their rooms and servants jumping to obey

perhaps waiting for an addition of her spouse.

A Lovely Path to the Lawn
  This shadowed path leads to the lawn where the majority of the
festivities are taking place. Above your head there are archways
of tree limbs and at your feet a soft path of gravel. Along either
side of you there is an impenetrable wall of tree trunks. If you
continue east you will reach the lawn.

Chairs by the Platform
  Row after row of chairs are lined up here in front of a platform.

the middle. From here you can hear the band playing a wedding

as though they've been sitting here for quite awhile. The platform
is to the east while the lawn continues west and south.

  This is where the actual marriage ceremony will take place.

raised about two feet off the lawn and is decorated with the
most expensive decorations. You are high enough up that you
can see over the whole lawn. The floor of the platform is
covered in white fabric and there are steps leading west to
an aisle. You can hear the impatient murmuring of the guests
from here as well as the wedding march being played by the
band.

[ Exits: south west ]
     The holy cross of the priest sits quietly in the corner.
(Golden Aura) A bridesmaid is staring off into space.
(Red Aura) The best man is here looking uncomfortable.
The priest is waiting impatiently.

n
Comfrey Fountain
  As you work your way through decorations and homemade goods,
you stumble upon this open square of fun and laughter. Ahead,
you can get a glance of the twinkling sparkle of a fountain.
This is the Comfrey Fountain, named after the Comfrey family
who have lived here for many generations.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) A beautiful diamond fountain gushes forth here.

or goddess would admire. Glancing at your reflection, you take
hold of the golden railing that leads up to the mahogany doors.

At the Grand Staircase
  You are standing at the base of an enormous staircase. This
staircase was designed for a variety of reasons, but mostly
to show off the wealth of the owner of the manor. It dates
back many generations but still looks almost like new. The
curving wooden banisters are polished to a shine and the
marble steps are covered in a red rug.

Lady Comfrey's Chambers
  This set of rooms has even more people running every which way
than the kitchen does. The room is huge, even larger than the
lord's. The floor is covered in extremely thick plush carpets
and there are broken art pieces everywhere. The walls are
covered in paintings of the lady herself. A large bed stands
alongside one wall of the room while another wall is completely
covered in mirrors. Above everything you hear a constant screeching
and screaming.

  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.

Before the manor
  Hideous gargoyles, screaming in eternal silence, are guarding the entrance to
the manor from a high perch above, and to either side of, the iron lined, 
wooden double doors. Five wide bluestone steps lead up to a tiled landing 
before the door, which is sheltered by an overhanging eave. On either side of
the door is a potted lemon tree, well pruned and cared for. To the east and 
west a path made from small white stones seems to lead around the manor.

>>    Aardington manor (1735)

Grand staircase (1735)

Grand hall (1735)

East wing
  The east wing of the manor has many doors along its length. To the north, 
halfway along the hallway, double doors with glass panels show the room 
within. A little further along is a door in the south wall with a large iron 
lock. Considering the wealth on display in the manor, there must be treasured
items within. At the far end of the east wing are highly ornate double doors 
with frosted glass panelling. There are many niches in the walls, which 
display antiques from all over Andolor. Vases of flowers are seated on highly
polished wooden pedestals, and tapestries and paintings adorn the walls along
the entire length of the hallway. Large chandeliers light up the wing with 
hundreds of candles.

[ Exits: (north) (east) (south) west ]
     (Magic) A vase of flowers sits on a wooden pedestal.
     (Magic) A large chandelier, adorned with many candles, lights up the hall.

East wing
  This is the family wing of the manor. The master bedroom is at the far end of
the wing and all the other bedrooms line the hall, some of them disused while
others are occupied by the current members of the family. Tables with family 
portraits dot the hallway and some of them go back many generations. Fresh 
flowers from the temple gardens adorn the tables, lending a fresh scent to 
the hallway. Polished floorboards echo the footsteps of all who walk on them.

>>    Bedroom
  A large feather bed nestles between a dresser and a study desk. A peach and 
white hand sewn quilt covers the bed and plump duck down pillows rest at the 
head of the bed. A tall mirror stands next to the wardrobe, which has been 
left open to reveal many dresses of various styles and colours. A plush white
wolf pelt lays on the floor next to the bed, its silky fur a delight for bare
feet. The window looks over a dark forest to the north and the estate's 
temple to the east. A flock of white birds flies by the window, their sudden,
noisy appearance a startling event.

>>    
Grand staircase
  A solid marble stair framed by a polished wooden balustrade opens up to the 
top floor of the manor. Opposite the top of the staircase is an antique 
wooden table with a vase of the biggest and brightest red and yellow tulips 
in the lands. There are two hallways that make up the east and west wings of 
the manor and many doors open up off them. Hanging above the centre of the 
staircase is a chandelier that is made up of five layers of rings containing 
magic crystals that twinkle gently with a pale blue light.

[ Exits: (north) east (south) west down ]
     (Magic) Hanging above the staircase is a magical chandelier.
     (Magic) A vase of tulips sits on an antique wooden table.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) A sprite, on delicate wings, flies around the manor.
A large oil painting of the manor hangs opposite the stairs.

>>    Bathroom
  A large marble bathtub is the dominant feature in this room. It is big enough
to easily accommodate the mightiest of men with room to spare. The floor is 
made of marble as are the washbasins near the windows, which have a wonderful
view over the kitchen gardens to the north. Brass towel racks hold thick, 
fluffy white towels which are cleaned every day. A large hamper sits beside 
the towel racks for all the used towels. A cupboard houses a pump which is 
used to both fill and empty the water from the tub and basins.

West wing
  There are a few doors along the length of the west wing, some stand open but 
have little of interest within. Some small statuettes sit on marble and 
wooden pedestals, created by famous artists long since dead. Tapestries, made
by the women of the house, adorn the walls and candelabra, fashioned from 
wrought iron, light the hallway against the night. Polished wooden 
floorboards shine in the light and echo the footsteps of all who walk upon 
them.

occupants. A couple of wardrobes and dressers hold infant clothes and cloth 
nappies that get recycled over the years.

>>    Master bedroom
  A large four-posted bed is the first thing that you see as you enter the 
room. There is a gossamer thin curtain draped back and tied at each post, 
which is made from a dark mahogany wood. A full length mirror, framed in the 
same wood as the bed, stands near a window. Two large wooden wardrobes stand 
side by side near the door. Lace curtains cover the window and are framed by 
thick, dark green velvet curtains. A dresser with many drawers holds makeup, 
perfume and hair combs for the lady of the house, and a matching dresser on 
the opposite wall holds aftershave and products for the man of the house.
Beside the bed on a small table is a gold necklace with a diamond pendant.
Rugs made from high quality animal skins are laid out in front of the fire 
place, which is freshly set.

>>    Bedroom
  This bedroom is very neat and clean. There are no wrinkles on the plain 
forest green quilt and the pillows are placed just so perfectly at the head 
of the bed. The dresser against the wall is made from a light maple and is 
quite modern when compared to the rest of the manor. A wardrobe made in the 
same style as the dresser has a mirrored door and a large potted palm stands 
beside it. The windows are closed and a white candle flickers on the desk 
beside the bed. Books are neatly stacked together on the desk, ready for 
study and a wooden chair is pushed up to rest against the lip of the desk.

portraits dot the hallway and some of them go back many generations. Fresh 
flowers from the temple gardens adorn the tables, lending a fresh scent to 
the hallway. Polished floorboards echo the footsteps of all who walk on them.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

     (Magic) Candelabra light the hallway against the night.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) A maid waters the plants and puts fresh flowers in the vases.

Grand staircase
  A solid marble stair framed by a polished wooden balustrade opens up to the 
top floor of the manor. Opposite the top of the staircase is an antique 
wooden table with a vase of the biggest and brightest red and yellow tulips 
in the lands. There are two hallways that make up the east and west wings of 
the manor and many doors open up off them. Hanging above the centre of the 
staircase is a chandelier that is made up of five layers of rings containing 
magic crystals that twinkle gently with a pale blue light.

[ Exits: north east south west down ]
     (Magic) Hanging above the staircase is a magical chandelier.
     (Magic) A vase of tulips sits on an antique wooden table.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) A sprite, on delicate wings, flies around the manor.
A large oil painting of the manor hangs opposite the stairs.

>>    Grand staircase
  A grand staircase with solid marble steps dominates the centre of the room.
Half-way up the staircase there is a wide landing, where the staircase splits
and branches off to each side, circling back on itself as it reaches up to 
the top floor. A smooth, highly ornate wooden balustrade frames the marble 
staircase. On either side of the staircase, the red carpet flows on and 
through to the rest of the manor, passing long windows framed by thick velvet
curtains, that show the perfectly manicured gardens and lawns. Large 
tapestries of various fight scenes and hunting expeditions, frozen in time, 
grace the spaces between the windows. Wooden tables and pedestals hold a 
variety of flowers and ornaments that look old and expensive.

     (Magic) A deep red carpet runs the length of the main hall.
     (Magic) A grand staircase with solid marble steps leads up to the second floor.

Grand hall
  A long hall stretches out before you, with access to the east and west wings 
of the manor. The solid marble floor is covered with a deep, rich red carpet 
runner, which muffles your footsteps. Archways to the east and west are 
framed by velvet drapes that match the ones on the windows. Portraits of the 
Earl's family, going back many generations, line the walls of the grand hall.
Beneath each picture are some words about the subject above. Between each 
picture are pillars of candles, elegantly displayed in wrought iron 
candelabras. As you walk through the hall, you get the feeling you are being 
watched, though the household staff are not paying you any special attention.

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]
     (Magic) A large chandelier, adorned with many candles, lights up the hall.
     (Magic) A deep red carpet runs the length of the main hall.

East wing
  The east wing of the manor has many doors along its length. To the north, 
halfway along the hallway, double doors with glass panels show the room 
within. A little further along is a door in the south wall with a large iron 
lock. Considering the wealth on display in the manor, there must be treasured
items within. At the far end of the east wing are highly ornate double doors 
with frosted glass panelling. There are many niches in the walls, which 
display antiques from all over Andolor. Vases of flowers are seated on highly
polished wooden pedestals, and tapestries and paintings adorn the walls along
the entire length of the hallway. Large chandeliers light up the wing with 
hundreds of candles.

[ Exits: (north) (east) (south) west ]

Sitting in a gold frame on the wall is a tapestry of some colourful birds.
In a gilded gold frame, this painting of a flying griffon hangs on the wall.
This painting is of a solitary house which sits on the edge of a farm.

>>    Ballroom
  The ballroom is quite large, with long frosted glass windows along the walls.
Outside the windows some white swans are swimming on a pond which is 
surrounded by tulips. Looking up at the ceiling of the ballroom, you can see 
some floating chandeliers drifting slowly along, which twinkle like starlight
in the evening. There is a raised platform to one side of the room where 
musicians gather during events to provide the music for dancing. Potted 
plants and colourful flowers decorate the small niches along the walls, 
adding vibrancy to the room.

Aardington manor
  The foyer of the large bluestone manor is quite imposing. Everything in the 
manor speaks of wealth; old and timeless wealth. The floor is made from a 
white and black marble, inlaid with gold veins and specks. A deep, rich red 
carpet runner extends down the length of the main hall from the other side of
the foyer. Solid, polished wooden pedestals stand on either side of the front
doors, and hold a large antique vase each, which are many centuries old.
Long glass windows, framed by thick velvet curtains, allow plenty of 
sunlight to filter in. The occasional guard can be seen patrolling the 
grounds. A butler, impeccably dressed, greets you in the foyer.

[ Exits: north south ]
     (Magic) This golden rope is perfect for tying back curtains or holding up your pants.
     (Magic) A polished wooden pedestal holds an antique vase.
     (Magic) A deep red carpet runs the length of the main hall.
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) An impeccably dressed butler greets you as you enter the foyer.
Made from a deep red velvet, these drapes frame the windows.

Before a temple
  The temple is made from the same stones that make up the manor itself. The 
temple is dedicated to Ayla, though it is open to all who seek peace and 
solitude. There are three low, flat bluestone steps leading up to the temple 
doors, which are made from a heavy wood and have large iron rings to open 
them outwards. On the walls either side of the door, ivy grows quite 
prolifically, the vines clinging to the stony surface.

[ Exits: north (east) south west ]
     (Magic) Ivy clings to the stony surface of the temple.
     (Magic) A white stone path is bordered by leafy green hedges.

(Red Aura) A busy little bee buzzes from flower to flower, collecting pollen.
(Red Aura) A bee busily buzzes from flower to flower collecting pollen.

>>    Temple foyer
  The foyer of the temple is cool and dim, allowing you to reflect on your time
here, whether coming or going. There are some ancient scrolls, situated 
behind glass, on pedestals to the left and right of the main doors. A white 
pillar candle, large enough to need three wicks, sits in each of the two 
arched niches, to the left and right of the inner temple door. Below each 
candle is a bronze plate, with offerings of gold and flowers, for the 
resident goddess, Ayla.

>>    Wooden pews

yellow daisies in her hand, weeping quietly towards the middle of the temple.

wooden pedestal.

A memorial alcove
  This alcove is dedicated to the memory of those who have passed from the 
living realms. Many small candles have been placed on long shelves along one 
of the walls. The wax from these candles has pooled and dried on the shelves,
creating a stable environment for the multitude of candles that have been 
placed here. A large box with a small slit at the top stands against the 
southern wall. Inside this box are letters to the goddess Ayla asking for 
help, blessings and offering of prayers.

>>    Entrance to the catacombs
  The air is stale and dusty down in the catacombs. A draft of fresh air, 
flowing down the stairwell to the east, stirs the once still cobwebs, causing
their inhabitants to scuttle in false anticipation of fresh food. Torches in 
iron sconces line the walls, flickering and dancing, sending their magically 
generated light into the room. To the south is a dark tunnel; the source of a
low moaning sound. A grating sound of bone scraping on stone is almost 
inaudible.

[ Exits: south up ]

Catacombs [**> PK <**]
  The walls of the catacombs are made of a soft sandstone, which crumbles 
slightly under your touch. The tiled floor has weathered the passage of time 
quite well, though one of them looks to have cracked. The air is dry and 
dusty, having been sealed up from the outside world for some time. A low moan
drifts to you from deeper into the tunnels that branch off to the east and 
west. To the north is the way out and back up to the temple.

[ Exits: north east west ]
(Red Aura) A shadow, as silky as midnight, slithers by, whispering words of death and darkness.

[**> PK <**] >>    Catacombs
  A long, low moan drifts to you through the dark tunnels to the south. The 
sound of splintering wood snaps in the background and something heavy falls 
to the tiled floor. A cold breath of stale air brushes past you, enticing 
goose bumps to form. The sandstone walls are cold to the touch and crumble 
slightly under pressure, the grit falling to the floor in small showers. The 
passageway to the south is dark, while to the east you can see the light from
the entrance to the catacombs.

Catacombs
  Deep into the catacombs you can see that the walls are lined with tombs. On 
both sides of the passageway are deep shelves and on each shelf is a wooden 
box, well-oiled to stand the test of time. Some of the coffins have been 
broken, their splinters scattered across the tiled floor. The former 
occupants of the damaged coffins are missing, but it doesn't look like they 
were stolen, rather more like they broke through their coffins from the 
inside as they were escaping their confines.

  A long, low moan drifts to you through the dark tunnels to the south. The 
sound of splintering wood snaps in the background and something heavy falls 
to the tiled floor. A cold breath of stale air brushes past you, enticing 
goose bumps to form. The sandstone walls are cold to the touch and crumble 
slightly under pressure, the grit falling to the floor in small showers. The 
passageway to the south is dark, while to the east you can see the light from
the entrance to the catacombs.

[ Exits: east south ]
(Red Aura) (Angry) A hideous zombie, eager to feed, stretches its arms out to you.
(Red Aura) A tormented ghost wails an unearthly song which grates on mortal ears.

Catacombs [**> PK <**] (1727)

Entrance to the catacombs
  The air is stale and dusty down in the catacombs. A draft of fresh air, 
flowing down the stairwell to the east, stirs the once still cobwebs, causing
their inhabitants to scuttle in false anticipation of fresh food. Torches in 
iron sconces line the walls, flickering and dancing, sending their magically 
generated light into the room. To the south is a dark tunnel; the source of a
low moaning sound. A grating sound of bone scraping on stone is almost 
inaudible.

[ Exits: south up ]
     (Magic) Torches in iron sconces flicker in the gloom.

A memorial alcove (1737)

Wooden pews
  At the front section of the pews you can see more of the temple. To the north
is a secluded alcove, with a wooden screen, which has been folded back 
against the wall, revealing two comfortable chairs. To the south is an alcove
with many candles burning in niches in the walls. To the north you can see 
the altar behind the pedestal, which is covered with fruit, flowers and 
plates of jewellery and gold. In the front pew is an old man, white beard 
flowing down his chest. He does not notice your presence, his eyes staring up
at the large tapestry of Ayla, hanging on the back wall, his lips moving 
ceaselessly in a never ending prayer to the goddess.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) Wooden pews line the main temple in neat rows.
(Golden Aura) With a stern expression on her face, the temple's head sister oversees her charges.
(Golden Aura) An old man with a flowing white beard is praying to Ayla.

>>    Wooden pews
  There are many wooden pews in the temple to choose from for quiet prayer and 
reflection. Some of these pews have occupants, who have come for their own 
varied reasons, to pray to Ayla for comfort and peace. There is an old couple
sitting in the back row, their hands clasped tightly in each other's as they 
seek comfort in their time of prayer. There is a young lady, with a bunch of 
yellow daisies in her hand, weeping quietly towards the middle of the temple.
At the far end is a raised dais, upon which a large book sits on a simple 
wooden pedestal.

pillar candle, large enough to need three wicks, sits in each of the two 
arched niches, to the left and right of the inner temple door. Below each

resident goddess, Ayla.

A path through the estate [**> PK <**] (1733)

Path around the manor (1733)

Path around the manor (1733)

Path around the manor (1733)

Before the manor
  Hideous gargoyles, screaming in eternal silence, are guarding the entrance to
the manor from a high perch above, and to either side of, the iron lined, 
wooden double doors. Five wide bluestone steps lead up to a tiled landing 
before the door, which is sheltered by an overhanging eave. On either side of
the door is a potted lemon tree, well pruned and cared for. To the east and 
west a path made from small white stones seems to lead around the manor.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) A white stone path is bordered by leafy green hedges.
A pure white butterfly flutters around its mate as they fly through the air.
(Golden Aura) A little blue wren hops along the path, before taking flight.
(Golden Aura) A gargoyle sits as still as stone, guarding the manor and those within.
(Golden Aura) A gargoyle sits as still as stone, guarding the manor and those within.

>>    Aardington manor (1733)

Grand staircase (1733)

Grand hall (1733)

East wing
  The east wing of the manor has many doors along its length. To the north, 
halfway along the hallway, double doors with glass panels show the room 
within. A little further along is a door in the south wall with a large iron 
lock. Considering the wealth on display in the manor, there must be treasured
items within. At the far end of the east wing are highly ornate double doors 
with frosted glass panelling. There are many niches in the walls, which 
display antiques from all over Andolor. Vases of flowers are seated on highly
polished wooden pedestals, and tapestries and paintings adorn the walls along
the entire length of the hallway. Large chandeliers light up the wing with 
hundreds of candles.

[ Exits: (north) east (south) west ]
     (Magic) A vase of flowers sits on a wooden pedestal.
     (Magic) A large chandelier, adorned with many candles, lights up the hall.
(Translucent) A wisp of smoke curls in the air, carrying with it a hint of tobacco.
Sitting in a gold frame on the wall is a tapestry of some colourful birds.
In a gilded gold frame, this painting of a flying griffon hangs on the wall.
This painting is of a solitary house which sits on the edge of a farm.

>>    Ballroom
  The ballroom is quite large, with long frosted glass windows along the walls.
Outside the windows some white swans are swimming on a pond which is 
surrounded by tulips. Looking up at the ceiling of the ballroom, you can see 
some floating chandeliers drifting slowly along, which twinkle like starlight
in the evening. There is a raised platform to one side of the room where 
musicians gather during events to provide the music for dancing. Potted 
plants and colourful flowers decorate the small niches along the walls, 
adding vibrancy to the room.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1360/1763 HP  1547/2233 MP  1738/1738 mv  763tnl  
Lv 83  G 481804 | Ballroom (W)
>>    East wing
  The east wing of the manor has many doors along its length. To the north, 
halfway along the hallway, double doors with glass panels show the room 
within. A little further along is a door in the south wall with a large iron 
lock. Considering the wealth on display in the manor, there must be treasured
items within. At the far end of the east wing are highly ornate double doors 
with frosted glass panelling. There are many niches in the walls, which 
display antiques from all over Andolor. Vases of flowers are seated on highly
polished wooden pedestals, and tapestries and paintings adorn the walls along
the entire length of the hallway. Large chandeliers light up the wing with 
hundreds of candles.

[ Exits: (north) east (south) west ]
     (Magic) A vase of flowers sits on a wooden pedestal.
     (Magic) A large chandelier, adorned with many candles, lights up the hall.
(Translucent) A wisp of smoke curls in the air, carrying with it a hint of tobacco.
Sitting in a gold frame on the wall is a tapestry of some colourful birds.
In a gilded gold frame, this painting of a flying griffon hangs on the wall.
This painting is of a solitary house which sits on the edge of a farm.

>>    Dining room
  The dining room is quite extravagant, with a long table capable of seating 
thirty dinner guests, as the centre of attraction. The wall panelling is dark
brown, which has recently been polished. The windows are slightly open which 
lets in a gentle breeze that barely rustles the curtains. A very large 
portrait hangs over the fireplace on the west wall and vases of flowers are 
sitting on pedestals between the windows.

[ Exits: south ]
     (Magic) A crystal goblet shimmers like diamonds in the light.
     (Magic) A vase of flowers sits on a wooden pedestal.
     (Magic) A long dining table is ready to seat up to thirty dinner guests.
     (Magic) A fire is crackling in a fireplace in the western wall.
A large portrait of man, sitting on an ornate chair, hangs over the fireplace.
A maid walks around the table, laying out all the place settings with care.
Made from a deep red velvet, these drapes frame the windows.

Dining room
  The dining room is quite extravagant, with a long table capable of seating 
thirty dinner guests, as the centre of attraction. The wall panelling is dark
brown, which has recently been polished. The windows are slightly open which 
lets in a gentle breeze that barely rustles the curtains. A very large 
portrait hangs over the fireplace on the west wall and vases of flowers are 
sitting on pedestals between the windows.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1411/1763 HP  1475/2233 MP  1738/1738 mv  763tnl  
Lv 83  G 481804 | East wing ([N][E][S]W)
>>    Grand hall
  A long hall stretches out before you, with access to the east and west wings 
of the manor. The solid marble floor is covered with a deep, rich red carpet 
runner, which muffles your footsteps. Archways to the east and west are 
framed by velvet drapes that match the ones on the windows. Portraits of the 
Earl's family, going back many generations, line the walls of the grand hall.
Beneath each picture are some words about the subject above. Between each 
picture are pillars of candles, elegantly displayed in wrought iron 
candelabras. As you walk through the hall, you get the feeling you are being 
watched, though the household staff are not paying you any special attention.

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]
     (Magic) A large chandelier, adorned with many candles, lights up the hall.
     (Magic) A deep red carpet runs the length of the main hall.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) Carrying a tray of tea and biscuits, this servant is humming a lilting
tune.
On the wall hangs a portrait of an unsmiling young lady with her mother.
A portrait of a man in shining armour holding his sword hangs on the wall.
An unsmiling young man in clerical robes looks down at you from a gilded frame.
Made from a deep red velvet, these drapes frame the archways to the east and west.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1411/1763 HP  1475/2233 MP  1738/1738 mv  763tnl  
Lv 83  G 481804 | Grand hall ([N]ESW)

e
East wing
  The east wing of the manor has many doors along its length. To the north, 
halfway along the hallway, double doors with glass panels show the room 
within. A little further along is a door in the south wall with a large iron 
lock. Considering the wealth on display in the manor, there must be treasured
items within. At the far end of the east wing are highly ornate double doors 
with frosted glass panelling. There are many niches in the walls, which 
display antiques from all over Andolor. Vases of flowers are seated on highly
polished wooden pedestals, and tapestries and paintings adorn the walls along
the entire length of the hallway. Large chandeliers light up the wing with 
hundreds of candles.

[ Exits: (north) (east) (south) west ]

This painting is of a solitary house which sits on the edge of a farm.

Grand hall
  A long hall stretches out before you, with access to the east and west wings 
of the manor. The solid marble floor is covered with a deep, rich red carpet 
runner, which muffles your footsteps. Archways to the east and west are 
framed by velvet drapes that match the ones on the windows. Portraits of the 
Earl's family, going back many generations, line the walls of the grand hall.
Beneath each picture are some words about the subject above. Between each 
picture are pillars of candles, elegantly displayed in wrought iron 
candelabras. As you walk through the hall, you get the feeling you are being 
watched, though the household staff are not paying you any special attention.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1411/1763 HP  1475/2233 MP  1738/1738 mv  763tnl  
Lv 83  G 481804 | Grand hall ([N]ESW)
w
>>    
West wing
  There are many doors along the hallway of the west wing of the manor. One 
wooden door to the north is slightly ajar and a wisp of smoke emerges from 
the room within, carrying with it the scent of tobacco. There is a large set 
of double doors in the south wall that catches your attention and is probably
worth a closer look. At the far end of the hallway is a single door that has 
carvings of roses in the panelling. Large chandeliers light up the wing with 
hundreds of candles, which are never allowed to burn out. Small tables 
adorned with vases and figurines are placed between the doors along the walls.
Paintings and tapestries adorn the walls above the small tables and their
artwork.

[ Exits: (north) east (south) (west) ]
     (Magic) A small table holds an assortment of figurines and vases.
     (Magic) A large chandelier, adorned with many candles, lights up the hall.
This delightful oil painting is a landscape scene featuring the Earl's manor.
A naked woman lying on a couch stares down at you from an antique gold frame.
A tapestry depicting a vase of roses adorns the wall.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1411/1763 HP  1475/2233 MP  1738/1738 mv  763tnl  
Lv 83  G 481804 | West wing (NE[S][W])
>>    The Earl's den
  The door opens silently and a small cloud of tobacco smoke hangs momentarily 
in the air before being dispersed by a small gust of wind through the open 
window. There is a large wooden desk in front of the windows, which have a 
lovely view of the estate. There are some open ledgers on the desk, as well 
as other accounting books for the estate. A pipe is resting in a bowl on the 
corner of the desk, which has recently been used and is still warm to the 
touch. Thick red carpet covers the floor and a low fire is burning in the 
fireplace in the eastern wall. There are some shelves of books that contains 
the Earl's private collection. On the wall beside the door are two spears 
crossed over each other with a gold plaque underneath.

[ Exits: south ]
     (Magic) This pipe has been recently used and is still warm to the touch. [3/3]
     (Magic) A large mahogany desk sits in front of the windows.
     (Magic) A thick, deep red carpet covers the floor.
     (Magic) A fire is burning low in the fireplace in the eastern wall.
Made from a deep red velvet, these drapes frame the windows.
The Earl of Aardington stands here before you, smiling in greeting.
The Earl of Aardington says, "Greetings, KumoGami, welcome to my family's
 manor."
The Earl of Aardington looks at you ponderingly.
The Earl of Aardington says, "You have an intelligent look about you, and
 I am in need of someone quick-witted to help with a few jobs around the
 estate. If you are willing, know that I will pay well. To help me out,
 please say yes."

[*Daily Blessing*] 1411/1763 HP  1475/2233 MP  1738/1738 mv  763tnl  
Lv 83  G 481804 | East wing ([N][E]SW)
>>    Trophy room
  As you walk into this room you see a group of animals ready to attack. Along 
one wall are animal heads mounted on plaques and displayed as prized kills.
In one corner is a statue of full plate mail armour with a sword and a shield
hung on the wall behind it. On the wall beside the door are shelves with 
various trophies from archery and sword fighting competitions. There are two 
comfortable chairs by the window with a small table between them. On the 
table is a decanter filled with brandy and two crystal goblets.

[ Exits: north ]
     (Magic) A decanter of brandy sits on a small table.
     (Magic) A comfortable chair faces another over a small table.
     (Magic) A set of full plate mail armour stands in one corner of the room.
(Red Aura) Mounted on the wall on a mahogany and gold plaque is the head of a medusa.
(Red Aura) Mounted on the wall on a mahogany plaque is the head of a panther.
(Red Aura) It's tail raised to strike, this manticore is in a most fearsome pose.
(Red Aura) (White Aura) Caught in an attack pose, this once mighty owlbear is a frightening sight.
(Red Aura) The beady eyes of a stuffed razorback seem to follow you around the room.
Made from a deep red velvet, these drapes frame the windows.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) An elderly dwarf is carrying a decanter of brandy and some fresh
goblets.

>>    East wing (1738)

Grand hall (1738)

West wing
  There are many doors along the hallway of the west wing of the manor. One 
wooden door to the north is slightly ajar and a wisp of smoke emerges from 
the room within, carrying with it the scent of tobacco. There is a large set 
of double doors in the south wall that catches your attention and is probably
worth a closer look. At the far end of the hallway is a single door that has 
carvings of roses in the panelling. Large chandeliers light up the wing with 
hundreds of candles, which are never allowed to burn out. Small tables 
adorned with vases and figurines are placed between the doors along the walls.
Paintings and tapestries adorn the walls above the small tables and their
artwork.

[ Exits: north east (south) (west) ]
     (Magic) A small table holds an assortment of figurines and vases.
     (Magic) A large chandelier, adorned with many candles, lights up the hall.
This delightful oil painting is a landscape scene featuring the Earl's manor.
A naked woman lying on a couch stares down at you from an antique gold frame.
A tapestry depicting a vase of roses adorns the wall.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1262/1763 HP  1241/2233 MP  1738/1738 mv  706tnl

[*Daily Blessing*] 1262/1763 HP  1241/2233 MP  1738/1738 mv  706tnl  
Lv 83  G 485499 | West wing (NE[S]W)
>>    Parlour
  This room surely belongs to the women of the house. The room is bright and 
airy and a garden of flowers grows under the windows, lending their mixed 
perfume to the room within through the open window. There are a few 
comfortable chairs, a low couch and a table with some wooden chairs that 
occupy the room. There is a fireplace in the south wall with a tapestry 
hanging above it. Needlework lies heaped in small piles on the table, waiting
to be worked on again. A spinning wheel stands in one corner, which has been 
worn dull and smooth from so much use over the years. A small table sits in 
between two of the armchairs with a steaming fresh pot of tea and two teacups
and saucers.

[ Exits: east ]

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.

enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
