>>    Walk of the Stars - Vespera
  Crimson light, like the ruddy hue of an unseen sunset, winds around these
stars.  And yet, unlike the Zenith trail, it does not seem malevolent, but
restful.  The path it takes runs from Kitalpha, past the moongate, then
north, parallel to Moonwalk until it reaches Kursa, and goes around Sham and
Tseen Kee on its way to Okda, and finally south to complete the loop. 
Kitalpha is directly south of here and Scheat is to the northeast, while
Novus Ordo is in the northeast, across the Antipodal Celestial Meridian.

The Main Street (1737)

The Main Street
  The street is crowded with Heavenswatch citizens wandering about with a
busy air.  The occasional guard or mage can be seen keeping a watchful eye
out for trouble.  To the south are the gates of the city, to the west the
sound of a hammer on anvil can be heard, and to the east a strange, warm
glow seems to spread.  The street continues north.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]

A dark forest
  Wandering through the forest was a bad idea. Not only is it cold and wet, but
also unnaturally dark. Regardless of the time of day, the forest stays the 
same brightness. Even the sounds of the forest have been muffled by some

A bright path (1697)

Entrance to the Warcamp
  The gates to the warcamp have been left open, and the guardposts have been 
deserted. There is virtually no traffic on the west side of the camp. Even 
the fortifications are in disrepair. The sounds of weapons being forged and 
recruits being yelled at break up the sounds of the forest to the west. The 
castle looms high above the camp, yet the camp is still safely protected by 
distance. It is not just the damage to the walls, there is something 
other-worldly about the castle to the east.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Red Aura) A kobold whelp has found a dagger and thinks he can help the cause.

help sustenance
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : SUSTENANCE.
Help Category : Survival.
Related Helps : Create Food, Forage.
Last Updated  : 2017-09-01 08:53:39.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast sustenance
Spell Number: 321

Certain classes have the ability to slow down their metabolism without
affecting combat and regeneration ability. This allows them to spend more
time out in the wild without needing to carry large amounts of supplies.

The speed at which a player becomes hungry/thirsty is more than halved while
under the effects of this spell.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1078/1791 HP  614/2265 MP  1738/1757 mv  880tnl  
Lv 84  G 522241 | Entrance to the Warcamp (NESW)

crc
cast 'word of recall'
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Lexicon the Navigator.
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Spublofe is always half AFK.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

>>    
Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Breathe in, Breathe out..
[AFK] (Player) (Red Aura) Roume wasn't built in a day. is sleeping on Medical beds.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Inix the Hunter is sleeping in a trivia sleeping bag.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Drimshade the Navigator.
[AFK] (Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Adarax is just the universe observing itself.
Lieutenant Pixie smiles up at you as she gets ready to amputate your leg.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1753)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..  

[ Exits: north up ]

1791/1791 HP  2265/2265 MP  1692/1757 mv  880tnl  
Lv 84  G 522241 | Within the Dark Forest (NU)
>>    
n
At the Mouth of a Cave (G)
  The path that you followed has led you to an uninviting cave.  It is dark
and eerie, your judgement tells you that it is not wise to proceed further. 
In the distance you hear the faint sounds of screams and swords slashing. 
Wondering what could be happening ahead you decide to continue into the cave
and explore.

Dark Cavern

beam of light slipped in and bounced off the crystal formations on the roof
of the cavern, illuminating the room...  You also realize that you are not
alone as you hear the familiar chants of Aylorian troops who are on their
way to defend the Citadel.

Underground Valley
  The light at the end of the tunnel!!  You feel so relieved after being
cramped up in the caverns.  You must be getting closer to the Citadel.  From
a distance, you can hear the warcries and clashing of swords..  Turning your
head towards the sounds, you come upon a small valley that has been burned
down by fighting.  You step closer to the burning bushes and trees and
hear the sounds grow stronger.  You must be close to the battlefield!

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Spublofe is always half AFK.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

9/1791 HP  2171/2265 MP  1756/1757 mv  890tnl  
Lv 84  G 522241 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>    
w
Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.

ago is sleeping on Medical beds.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)

Deep Jungle (1693)

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..  

[ Exits: north up ]

At the Mouth of a Cave (G)
  The path that you followed has led you to an uninviting cave.  It is dark
and eerie, your judgement tells you that it is not wise to proceed further. 
In the distance you hear the faint sounds of screams and swords slashing. 
Wondering what could be happening ahead you decide to continue into the cave
and explore.

Before the Fabled City
  The City of Stone looms ahead of you.  The towering stone monuments of
the city contrast with the luscious green of your immediate surroundings.  It
appears majestic, the simple curves of the stone buildings reflect the
sunset slightly, creating an almost eerie feeling.  From this distance you
can't see any movement or life inside the city.  Wondering if the city will
be as quiet and serene inside its walls as it appears from here, you
continue on your journey.

w
Stone Avenue
  The sounds of people talking, gravel crunching underfoot and wheels
squeaking surround you as you walk down the Stone Avenue.  All sorts of
people hurry past you as they go about their business.  The buildings that
line the street are tall and for the most part uninviting.  To the west you
notice a guardhouse that has been destroyed.  Another guardhouse which
appears in good condition lies to the east and the square lies to the north.

s
Before the Fabled City
  The City of Stone looms ahead of you.  The towering stone monuments of
the city contrast with the luscious green of your immediate surroundings.  It
appears majestic, the simple curves of the stone buildings reflect the
sunset slightly, creating an almost eerie feeling.  From this distance you
can't see any movement or life inside the city.  Wondering if the city will
be as quiet and serene inside its walls as it appears from here, you
continue on your journey.  

[ Exits: north west ]
(Invis) (Golden Aura) A sharp-eyed Falcon takes a rest from hunting here.
(Red Aura) A tall zebra stands here grazing.

cast 'word of recall'
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Spublofe is always half AFK.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Mudpits (G) (1756)

Recreation Room (G) (1755)

Boot Clan Public Hall (G) (1754)

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1753)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Deep Jungle (1693)

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..  

[ Exits: north up ]

507/1791 HP  823/2265 MP  1692/1757 mv  453tnl  
Lv 84  G 527809 | Within the Dark Forest (NU)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
u


Deep Jungle
  The jungle is much darker here than to the north.  The vegetation is no
longer shades of vivid green, but rather those of brown and red.  The trees
are thin and oddly angled.  Vines that once hung loosely from the branches
of these trees now wrap around them in a parasitic embrace.  Noxious fumes
from nearby tar pools permeate the air.  Animals tend to avoid this part of
the jungle because they will find no sustenance here.  There is a wide hole
in the underbrush here covered in the usual litter of decay.  

[ Exits: north east south west down ]

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..

At the Mouth of a Cave (G)

>>    *[NOEXP]* Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east down ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     An old electric heater.

[AFK] (Player) (White Aura) Adarax is just the universe observing itself.

59/1791 HP  2153/2265 MP  1756/1757 mv  726tnl  
Lv 84  G 527809 | Medical lounge (ED)
e
>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Lexicon the Navigator.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Lv 84  G 527809 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
e
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
e
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

159/1791 HP  2265/2265 MP  1754/1757 mv  726tnl  
Lv 84  G 527809 | Recreation Room (ESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
e
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Lexicon the Navigator.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1752)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Deep Jungle (1692)

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..  

[ Exits: north up ]

1791/1791 HP  2235/2265 MP  1691/1757 mv  726tnl  
Lv 84  G 518209 | Within the Dark Forest (NU)
>>    *[NOEXP]*

n
At the Mouth of a Cave (G)
  The path that you followed has led you to an uninviting cave.  It is dark
and eerie, your judgement tells you that it is not wise to proceed further. 
In the distance you hear the faint sounds of screams and swords slashing. 
Wondering what could be happening ahead you decide to continue into the cave
and explore.

cramped up in the caverns.  You must be getting closer to the Citadel.  From

hear the sounds grow stronger.  You must be close to the battlefield!

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Lexicon the Navigator.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

n
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Outside the Aylorian Academy (G)
  Standing before the main entrance of the Aylorian Academy, you can't help but
notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave 
on this realm is to be determined by your actions, by fate, by skill and by 
chance. 

Type 'North' to begin your journey...

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

Zenith Trail (1744)

Zenith Trail
  This shining, golden path across the heavens appears to be formed from
the light of Canopus by the nearby desert planet.  It is no doubt a form of
solar energy converted by the pool of light which that world gathers from
the Moonwalk.  The trail flows south from there, across the Celestial
Equator, and down until it reaches Onexia Prime.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

w
Linear A
  Futhark the Elder, in ages past, wrote many things upon the sky so that
he would never be far from his spellbooks, or indeed the rest of his
library.  Unlike Linear B, which is mostly comprehensible, Linear A is a
complete mystery to anyone but Futhark, who is long dead.  A single rune is
visible here, glowing red.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1791/1791 HP  1945/2265 MP  1742/1757 mv  863tnl (Reply: Gorsk) 
Lv 84  G 521282 | Linear A (NESW)
n
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
Maia (G)
  Also called the Archivist's Star, it is thought that an ancient library
from ages past was relocated here during the Cataclysm.  Though now safe
from the Demonlord's rampage, it is unknown whether it will ever be
reopened.  Because of the danger, the spells protecting the archive make it
so that it can only be opened from the inside.  Given that the Cataclysm is
long over, many fear that all inside it have simply perished, and that it
will be lost forever.  And yet, others hope that they are merely being
overly cautious, pointing out that some could have survived, as it were, by
becoming undead.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1791/1791 HP  1945/2265 MP  1741/1757 mv  863tnl (Reply: Gorsk) 
Lv 84  G 521282 | Maia (NESW)
n
>>    *[NOEXP]* Holtzman's Space
  This luminous reservoir of ink was created by the Wizard of Holtzman,
Guilielmus Xylander, who assisted Futhark the Elder before Rorschach did. 
Created to aid in the construction of Linear A, it once contained far more
ink, but the ink was used up far more quickly than expected, being drawn to
the star Maia before most of it could be used.  This is what led Futhark the
Elder to later create Linear B.  Some amuse themselves here by finding
shapes in the blobs of ink.  One of the blobs here looks like a goat eating
a pillow.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

u
Before the Keep
  A towering wall stands here. It is composed of large stone blocks that 
form a wall that extends for about 50 yards in each direction before the 
walls turn to the north. The wall stretches far up above you, and is topped 
with jagged, razor-sharp pieces of metal. The only way into the keep is 
through the wooden gate to the north.

[ Exits: (north) down ]
A tall, strange man stands here waiting in the shadows.
Galkorum asks, "Hello my friend. Would you be interested in helping me to
 release some unjustly imprisoned friends of mine?"
 
Galkorum says, "If you are willing to help me, then not only will you be
 freeing those that have been unjustly imprisoned by those sanctimonious
 keepers, but you would also be able to have access to the items and jewels
 that these keepers have kept to themselves for millennia."
 
Galkorum asks, "So what do you say, are you willing to free some unjustly
 accused prisoners and make yourself rich at the same time?"

>>    *[NOEXP]* Inside the Keep
  The interior of the keep appears to be a clean, well-used place. There are 
polished stone floors, paintings can be seen on the walls to the east and 
west, and natural lighting comes in from the windows set into the walls. Up 
ahead, two sets of staircases can be seen rising up to the second floor of 
the keep. Directly across from you is a door that appears to lead outside.

[ Exits: north (east) south west ]

Northern Vestibule
  The stone sides of the stairs on either side of you combine to form a hallway
leading towards the back of the keep. To the south, the main foyer and other 
rooms within the keep can be seen, and to the north is a sturdy door that 
leads out of the keep. A small window in the door allows you to see several 
kinds of flowers, as well as 4 obelisks that surround a dark, domed, energy 
field off to the north.

  This room is about 10 feet by 10 feet by 10 feet. The floor and ceiling

Striking Flowers (1748)

Out of the corner of your eye, you see a flower turning to watch you...
Floral Passage
  Several beautiful red flowers attached to thorny green vines are arranged 
here. Although they are climbing a set of lattices, the vines have also grown
up and into each other, creating a doorway that you would have to walk 
through. You can see flowers to the north and south, and 4 obelisks can been 
seen around a dome of energy to the east.

crc
cast 'word of recall'
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (Golden Aura) Relek of the past!.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Lexicon the Navigator.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

w
Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Aardington Estate
  You stand before a large wrought iron gate which is tipped with iron 
arrowheads and decorated with an iron worked coat of arms. To either side of 
the gate is a long iron fence disguised by dark green leafy shrubs, giving it
the natural appearance of a simple hedge at first glance. On the other side 
of the gate is a path of small white stones, which leads directly to an 
enormous bluestone manor situated in the middle of a vast, sprawling estate.

The stables
  A cacophony of animal sounds is coming from a large wooden building, whose 
doors are flung wide open. This is quite obviously the Earl's stables, which 
houses a wondrous variety of creatures, some of which he uses as steeds and 
others which he keeps as work animals or living trophies. The Earl's staff 
are busy looking after the animals, feeding them and mucking out the stalls.

[ Exits: south up ]
A proud griffon rests quietly in his stall.
(Golden Aura) A strong, young man is tending to the animals quite diligently.
(Red Aura) A wyvern is resting in his stall after a large meal.
(Golden Aura) A pure white unicorn dips her head at your approach.
As still as a rock, a giant lizard is sleeping in her stable.
(Golden Aura) A black pegasus, wings folded against his sides, snorts at your presence.

u
The hayloft
  This is a large hayloft where most of the hay is stored. Off to one side 
there is some bedding where the stable hands sleep at night, so they can take
turns to keep a watchful eye on the Earl's prized pets. From this vantage 
point you can see into every stall, all of which are filled with fresh hay.
The smell of the animals is rather cloying up here as the stables are kept 
heated for the comfort of the animals.

[ Exits: down ]

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The King's Royal Box
  You stand in the King's Royal Box.  This is where the Royal Family and
various other important people get to sit to watch the tournament.  From
here you have a perfect view of the action going on down in the arena.  The
box has recently been repainted, and looks straight into the arena, close
enough that the competitors' expressions can be discerned.  Royal tapestries
of Illoria adorn the walls, and servers come and go, bringing the Royal
Family food.  Looking down, you think you see something moving below the
floorboards, but decide that it must be your overactive imagination.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1833)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

help gate
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : GATE.
Help Category : Transport.
Related Helps : Doorway.
Last Updated  : 2017-09-01 08:58:42.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax:  cast 'gate' <target>
Spell Number: 50

The gate spell is a powerful transportation magic that opens up a portal
between your character and another living target somewhere else in the 
world.  Private and no-recall rooms may not be gated into, and you may not
leave a no-recall room via the gate spell.

Additionally, attempting to cast this spell towards monsters which are
sufficiently more powerful than you, any player level 200 or higher, and 
any player with nosummon on, will fail.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1670/1751 HP  1255/2265 MP  1837/1837 mv  613tnl (Reply: Gorsk) 
Lv 84  G 572730 | Hallway of light (EW)

  You stand in a hallway lit from above by bright sunlight flooding in through 
beautiful stained-glass windows high above. The floor is composed of large 
slabs of polished marble, and the walls are covered with tapestries of spun 
silver and gold cloth. The hallway continues west, and a large door lies to

crecall; campaign request
cast 'word of recall'
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Mesolarian Grassland (1821)

Aardington Estate
  You stand before a large wrought iron gate which is tipped with iron 
arrowheads and decorated with an iron worked coat of arms. To either side of 
the gate is a long iron fence disguised by dark green leafy shrubs, giving it
the natural appearance of a simple hedge at first glance. On the other side 
of the gate is a path of small white stones, which leads directly to an 
enormous bluestone manor situated in the middle of a vast, sprawling estate.

[ Exits: north south ]
     (Magic) A stray leaf from the shrubs bordering the estate lies on the ground.
     (Magic) A wrought iron gate is tipped with iron arrowheads.

1741/1751 HP  1903/2265 MP  1837/1837 mv  577tnl (Reply: Gorsk) 
Lv 84  G 632149 | Aardington Estate (NS)
>>    A path through the estate (1837)

Before the manor
  Hideous gargoyles, screaming in eternal silence, are guarding the entrance to
the manor from a high perch above, and to either side of, the iron lined, 
wooden double doors. Five wide bluestone steps lead up to a tiled landing 
before the door, which is sheltered by an overhanging eave. On either side of
the door is a potted lemon tree, well pruned and cared for. To the east and 
west a path made from small white stones seems to lead around the manor.

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]
     (Magic) A white stone path is bordered by leafy green hedges.
(Golden Aura) A beautiful lorikeet flies by in a rainbow of colour.
(Golden Aura) A gargoyle sits as still as stone, guarding the manor and those within.
(Golden Aura) A gargoyle sits as still as stone, guarding the manor and those within.
A potted lemon tree sits beside the door to the manor.
A potted lemon tree sits beside the door to the manor.

1741/1751 HP  1903/2265 MP  1837/1837 mv  577tnl (Reply: Gorsk) 
Lv 84  G 632149 | Before the manor (NESW)
>>    Aardington manor (1837)

Grand staircase (1837)

Grand hall (1837)

West wing
  There are many doors along the hallway of the west wing of the manor. One 
wooden door to the north is slightly ajar and a wisp of smoke emerges from 
the room within, carrying with it the scent of tobacco. There is a large set 
of double doors in the south wall that catches your attention and is probably
worth a closer look. At the far end of the hallway is a single door that has 
carvings of roses in the panelling. Large chandeliers light up the wing with 
hundreds of candles, which are never allowed to burn out. Small tables 
adorned with vases and figurines are placed between the doors along the walls.
Paintings and tapestries adorn the walls above the small tables and their
artwork.

[ Exits: (north) east (south) (west) ]
     (Magic) A small table holds an assortment of figurines and vases.
     (Magic) A large chandelier, adorned with many candles, lights up the hall.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) An elderly dwarf is carrying a decanter of brandy and some fresh
goblets.
This delightful oil painting is a landscape scene featuring the Earl's manor.
A naked woman lying on a couch stares down at you from an antique gold frame.
A tapestry depicting a vase of roses adorns the wall.

1741/1751 HP  1903/2265 MP  1837/1837 mv  577tnl (Reply: Gorsk) 
Lv 84  G 632149 | West wing ([N]E[S]W)
>>    Parlour
  This room surely belongs to the women of the house. The room is bright and 
airy and a garden of flowers grows under the windows, lending their mixed 
perfume to the room within through the open window. There are a few 
comfortable chairs, a low couch and a table with some wooden chairs that 
occupy the room. There is a fireplace in the south wall with a tapestry 
hanging above it. Needlework lies heaped in small piles on the table, waiting
to be worked on again. A spinning wheel stands in one corner, which has been 
worn dull and smooth from so much use over the years. A small table sits in 
between two of the armchairs with a steaming fresh pot of tea and two teacups
and saucers.

[ Exits: east ]

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

On a Dull Forest Trail (1794)

The end of the path (G)
  You seem to have reached the end of the path.  All around you, you see
nothing but huge dark trees, leaving you no other choice but to go back
south....  Hey, what is that light you see, through the bushes to the north?

[ Exits: north south ]
     A little branch has just fallen from the tree.

>>    Behind the bushes (1836)

Entering a Smelly Town
  You are just outside the entrance of a disgusting smelling town.  A huge
wooden wall continues east and west as far as your eye can see, and probably
surrounds the town.  Next to the entrance, you see a metal plaque.  A small
footpath follows the wall in both directions.  

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]
( 2) (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A spiked shield is sticking against the wall.
( 2) An axe, made of bones from a defeated dragon, lies here.
     (Magic) A cruel blacksmith has made a belt made of elven skin.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Cirrus [[moshimo inochiga egaketara]] is fighting the troll guard.

The Military Training Grounds
  Fighting through the hordes of creatures which are released as
practice targets for the trolls, you have reached the east part of the
training grounds.  From here you can go south, to the source of the
creatures you just encountered, west to a giant obelisk or north to a
relatively quiet part of the area.

The Military Training Grounds
  You stand in the middle of the training grounds.  Here the duels seem to
be the hardest and the creatures the toughest.  Exactly in the middle, you
see a huge stone pillar with a chain attached to its top, so big and heavy
that no creature in Aylor should be able to break it, or even drag it one
inch.  A group of trolls forms a circle around the pillar with their swords
drawn and their spears aimed.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Red Aura) A dragon spreads his wings in an attempt to escape his doom. 
A young troll is looking for a creature to practice his fighting skills.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Mons Brevia (1850)

Approaching a small mining camp
  A raging dust storm swirls about the base of the mountain, piercing your
weathered eyes with its ungodly strength.  You grit your teeth against the
pain and struggle onward, hoping the storm will soon cease.  The side of the
mountain to your east is as black as charred flesh and there are no green
plants to lend color or life to the scene.  The wind does not let up, and
you hasten to find some kind of shelter.  May this forsaken place be forever
damned.  

[ Exits: south up ]
     A fresh oak sign protrudes from the charred ground.
Beatrice the adventurer walks about here, scaling the mountain.
Beatrice sits down on a large rock, takes a sandwich out of her backpack, and begins to chew
silently. After a minute or two she spots you.
Beatrice asks, "Hi, I'm Beatrice. Who are you?"
You tell Beatrice that your name is KumoGami.
Beatrice asks, "Nice to meet you, KumoGami. Perhaps you would like to know
 more about Sargasso?"
Beatrice says, "You can say 'Cathedral', 'Castle', or 'Mine' to be sent to
 those parts of DSR."

say castle


You say 'castle'
Outside the throne room
  You have greatly enjoyed your journey through Sargasso, the underworld,
and this mysterious town/castle, but now all that is behind you.  You stand
in front of the diamond door to the throne room, where you can at last meet
Queen Angelina, whose grace and wisdom you have heard much about.  Your heart
starts to race with excitement, and you want to tear down the door just so
you can see her more quickly.  You will yourself to calm down however, and
take time out to think of what you will say to her.  As you ponder this
important question, you admire the statues of the queen that guard the
throne room like angels of eternity.  They were sculpted from pure diamond,
but their eyes are aquamarine, their staves sapphires, their halos topaz, and
their fingernails rubies.  Its almost as if Queen Angelina summoned the
powers from all corners of her realm to protect her throne room from hatred
and destruction.  Taking a deep breath, you finally realize what you will
say to her and decide to open the door.  

[ Exits: (east) west ]
(Golden Aura) One of Angelina's bodyguards stands here, protecting the throne.
(Golden Aura) One of Angelina's bodyguards stands here, protecting the throne.
(Golden Aura) One of Angelina's bodyguards stands here, protecting the throne.

Inside Diamond Castle (1856)

Inside Diamond Castle (1856)

Inside Diamond Castle
  Two tapestries woven of pure silken threads grace the diamond walls of
the hallway, each depicting a turning point of not just the castle, but of
the whole city as well.  Crystalline suits of armor line the walls,
absorbing the light then dispersing it in a prismatic spiral.  The
chandelier hanging from the ceiling has no candles with which to
illuminate the corridor, yet it gives off a tranquil radiance which urges
you to release all your pent up hatreds and phobias.  Your eyelids slowly
drift downwards as you fall into a deep healing trance.  Here, above all
other places, you feel safe.  

[ Exits: east (west) ]

1611/1788 HP  1287/2293 MP  1856/1856 mv  602tnl (Reply: Gorsk) 
Lv 85  G 643740 | Inside Diamond Castle (E[W])
>>    *[NOEXP]* You open the door.

1611/1788 HP  1287/2293 MP  1856/1856 mv  602tnl (Reply: Gorsk) 
Lv 85  G 643740 | Inside Diamond Castle (EW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Inside Diamond Castle
  After opening the diamond gate and entering the castle, your senses are
overcome with amazement and wonder.  Even the inner walls of this
magnificent castle are made of diamond.  As you step across the floor, the
shock of your feet smacking the ground is absorbed, and instead of making a
cacophonous sound, you hear a soft bell chiming in the distance.  It seems
as if the destructive sound energy is converted into a harmonious melody. 
You sigh in utter bliss as you realize that nothing will hurt you here ... 
provided you treat it well.  To your north is a diamond fence which
separates the rest of the castle from the arborium, and to the south is the
castle dining room.  The castle hallway continues east.  

[ Exits: (north) east (south) (west) ]

1611/1788 HP  1287/2293 MP  1856/1856 mv  602tnl (Reply: Gorsk) 
Lv 85  G 643740 | Inside Diamond Castle ([N]ES[W])
>>    *[NOEXP]* Inside the dining room (1856)

Inside the dining room
  The long rectangular table of Diamond Castle's dining room continues
here.  The large, plush red chairs indicate to you that this corner of the
room is designated for the most wealthy and most honored guests.  These
people smile in a very fake way, acknowledge your presence, then turn around
and continue their mindless babbling.  Talk about your stuffy nobility!  You
might as well leave these pompous morons to their own devices, as nobility
can bring nothing but trouble.  Muttering something about their lineage
under your breath, you leave their part of the table.  You didn't want their
cruddy old food anyway.  The dining room continues north and east, while the
kitchen is down below.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Into the dark (G)
  You have entered a room of nothingness; there is no sound, no breeze, no
sign of life whatsoever, just a large dark hole.  This hole is said to lead
to a world of eternal darkness that is sure to drive you mad if you wander
through it for too long.

1788/1788 HP  2293/2293 MP  1813/1856 mv  602tnl (Reply: Gorsk) 
Lv 85  G 646503 | Into the dark (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Reliquary Asteroid Field
  This place was formed during the martyrdom of St. Vesper when he faced
down a great demon to save his parish.  He managed to lure the demon away
from the people and over to a small shrine in the countryside where he
invoked its power to destroy the demon.  Unfortunately, the demon had at
that same moment unleashed an abyssal force to murder the priest.  St. 
Vesper thus became a martyr, the demon was sent back to hell, and various
remains of the shrine were thrown so violently into the sky that they wound
up here, not far from Absolvo Te, the Mercy Star, which they were surely
drawn to.  A burse, missing its corporal, floats here.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

Imperial Guard's Barracks
  You are standing in the barracks of the Imperial Guard. The room is filled 
with bunk beds. A small table has been set up in the corner of the room, and a
scattered deck of cards lies there. Small lockers sit under the beds, but are
locked tight. The room looks like it has been cleaned recently as there isn't
a speck of dust to be seen.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.

in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

help talon
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Talon.
Help Category : Attack spell.
Related Helps : Vampiric Touch.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-26 18:37:21.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast talon <victim>
Damage: Pierce
Spell Number: 347

This spell summons vicious, searing blades of energy from the caster's
fingertips.  This magical energy is so fierce and compact that it feels 
like actual daggers as it tears through victims, cutting into even the most
magic-resistant foes.

Primary Stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : Wisdom, Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) Talbor the Enchanter.
(Player) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Spublofe is always half AFK.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.

beds.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1771)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Huldra Forest (1707)

A dark forest
  Wandering through the forest was a bad idea. Not only is it cold and wet, but
also unnaturally dark. Regardless of the time of day, the forest stays the 
same brightness. Even the sounds of the forest have been muffled by some 
unseen force. The remains of an animal trail loop and twist around, 
eventually extending out of sight.

A bright path (1775)

Entrance to the Warcamp (1774)

A path through the camp
  The muddy ground has been trodden by countless kobolds running errands for 
their officers. The forest to the west has been cut back to accommodate the 
tents required to run the siege. The camp runs from the north to the south, 
with tents all along the main path. Unlike the western gates to the camp, the
eastern gate has been well-maintained and is under constant guard. The path 
leading east out of the camp is almost as worn as the main path. The only 
permanent structure, a one-room building made of wood and clay, lies to the 
west.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

A path through the camp
  The muddy ground has been trodden by countless kobolds running errands for 
their officers. The forest to the west has been cut back to accommodate the 
tents required to run the siege. The camp runs from the north to the south, 
with camps all along the main path. This seems to be a main thoroughfare for 
traveling from the north and south ends of the camp. A massive battering ram 
is being constructed to the west, while the deafening sound of soldiers is 
coming from the south.

>>    *[NOEXP]* A path through the camp
  The muddy ground has been trodden by countless kobolds running errands for 
their officers. The forest to the west has been cut back to accommodate the 
tents required to run the siege. The path splits here, one less-used path 
continuing south and another to the east. The sounds of soldiers move from 
the south to the east as two large tents can be seen to the south. The 
soldiers' barracks and sparring arena to the east are swarming with kobolds, 
many of them armed and armored.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1772)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

A small dwelling
  You are standing in a small home of a hawklord family who moved out of the 
housing units, or perhaps they were kicked out. Due to the close nature of 
the hawklords, it is rare for a family to move out by themselves. However 
this family has kept the small house in tight shape. Similar to the housing 
units, there are bunk beds in a row with trunks in front of the bed. A large 
dresser sits alongside the east wall, and a kitchen area is in the southwest 
corner. A few pictures hang on the wall.
